conclusion: To determine the direction of the light ray when it first exits the prism, we need to analyze the refractive behavior of the prism and the light ray.
The refractive index of the prism is given as n = √2.
Using Snell's law (n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2), we calculate the angle of refraction (∠OBE).
Substituting values into Snell's law: sin θ2 = (√2 sin 60°) / √2 = √3/2.
The angle of refraction θ2 = arcsin(√3/2) ≈ 56.57°.
The light ray enters the prism perpendicularly from O along AD, with an angle of incidence of 60° and an angle of refraction of 56.57°.
The light ray will exit the prism at an angle of 60° - 56.57° = 3.43° from the perpendicular direction.
The direction of the light ray when it first exits the prism is 3.43° from the perpendicular direction.
